I think this is a good idea
This is perfect for horses and should definitely be added.
There could also be special enchantments that let your horse run faster or jump higher! This would be great!
Horseshoes would be a fun item to create out of iron and could make your horse possible faster!

Horses would have a new horseshoe slot.

The blacksmith should sell them.

Iron, gold and maybe diamond variant.

Each material (iron, gold, diamond, etc) would have different levels of durability, similar to player body armor, and can support enchantments for the horse.  Frost Walker, Fire Protection, Jumper (for higher jumps, perhaps 1.5, 2, 3 times per level of enchantment), Speed (for running faster).

 

Shoes could allow the horse to jump slightly higher without enchantments, but the highest level of Jump enchantment could scale a mountain easily and jump over two story structures (8 blocks high).  Shoes could also allow the horse to run faster, giving the player bursts of speed when outrunning mobs or chasing the sun.

Horse shoes should get the same enchantments as boots. Therefore, Soul Speed should be an enchantment for horse shoes, also. Then, we can build roads out of soul sand and soul soil for fast transportation over hilly terrain. The horse shoes could come as leather, iron, diamond, and netherite. 

I would also like to add horse-drawn carts, wheels for horse carts and minecarts, and soul concrete made from soul sand instead of regular sand. I would also like to add 16 colors of cement, to replace dye in concrete powder recipes, crafted with a respective dye, clay, and lime, another new item obtained from limestone, a new stone type. Alternatively, asphalt can be used instead of cement to make asphalt or soul asphalt concrete, depending on which sand you use. All of this will make many different materials to use for roads. Asphalt could also be used to craft shingles for an additional option for roofs.

Horseshoes depending on the material could aid a specific horse‚Äôs flaws. Chain horseshoes could prevent slowness on sticky and slow moving/flowing blocks(possibly sculk protection if added), gold for horses that are flawed in speed slightly improving it, copper makes them lighting resistant(possibly able to hold a single charge), iron gives them a resistance boost, diamond can allow for higher jumps, and adding netherite horse armor could allow for two players to ride also giving resistance and with netherite horseshoe a speed and jump boost. Horseshoe can be enchanted like armor. Could add two more rare enchantments like ‚Äúachilles heel I-III‚Äù allowing player or horse breif levitation on jump(has to jump twice for activation & can only be found in Ancient ruins, Strongholds, & End Dimension), and ‚Äúram charge I-II‚Äù allowing player or horse the ability to run into enemies doing slight damage and knockback(should usually have a chance of finding at pillager outpost). Frost walker could then be applied to horseshoes aswell. Horseshoes should also be a throwable (throwing also depletes durability) that could be recollected dealing damage according to its material.
Maybe the armor could be water or fire proof like underwater breathing

They are not really much of a desert critter though. Maybe a Coyote could be better.(I've personally seen one with a lush coat  above death valley and many mangy ones in fort Irwin CA) maybe make donkeys able to occasionally spawn in deserts,( some were wandering about by fort Irwin too.)

OK, they don't live in deserts, and meerkats and baobabs are going to be in savannas. Komodos should be found in a very rare, new variant of the jungle that mainly spawns as an island, since they live on small islands in Indonesia. Instead of shooting venom, they should act like they do in real life: bite the victim to give them venom and deadly bacteria, then jump back and wait for them to die. They should hunt any and all warm-blooded animals (except dolphins, humans, villagers, piglins, piglin brutes, striders, and all other Nether or End mobs), but only kill one every 5 minutes. They then take the meat from the dead animal. They should not drop useful things when killed, but instead you can maybe shear them for scales?

It appears there is a similar post on this idea already being talked about! Help your ideas make it into Minecraft and join existing threads in progress, even if your idea isn't an exact match - we read ALL the comments. Thank you for putting your time and energy into this post. Players like yourself help drive forward the creative boundaries of Minecraft for our community. Don't forget to upvote good comments!

Finding a huge, luminous squid drifting through the darkness would be fantastic.
The speed of squids should also match their size, considering larger squids would probably get more speed off of their self-propulsion than tiny ones.

I also had this thought and think it would be cool! To see many tiny pulsating lights in the dark waters of an underground cave and then suddenly the glowing of a much larger squid pushing its way through the others in all its squidy glory. Lol, don‚Äôt ask üòÇ. But I support this suggestion! :D

oooooo I like that

I like your idea, but honestly I don‚Äôt think these amazing mini beasts should be tameable or rideable though. But hear are some other suggestions to make them more interesting.

‚Ä¢ Young Rhino beetles would gather in large numbers in the full moon to moult, which is their most vulnerable time, with only 4 hearts and no armour. They are also unable to move much when doing this, and after they have completed moulting, they would become a fully fledged adult and would drop their hide, which could be used in several potions. 

‚Ä¢ They would actively eat mushrooms, which help them to heal and grow faster. You may even feed them mushrooms to gain their trust, which would make them more passive towards you and would also help you attack hostile mobs (except creepers and phantoms).

‚Ä¢ Adult Rhino beetles are territorial, and would mark their territory by stripping wood. In the new moon, adults would compete with each other for territory by bashing into them and hurling them out, using the point system to see who wins. Hurling- 2 points per block,  bashing- 1 point per block. Battles are rarely fatal.

‚Ä¢Rhino beetles have unique strength stats, with some able to deal more damage and hurl even further, and in rare cases, are even able to fly for short distances.

As you can see, Rhino beetle behaviour is very tied to the moon cycle, which would help boost the usefulness of it.

Damn, I felt sure I was going to be the first with this one.

Had an epiphany while working in the nether yesterday. Wouldn't it be great to have an enormous serpent that lives in the lava seas of the nether. I giant snake like creature that surfaces like the Loch Ness Monster and attacks unwary people too close to, sailing on (hopefully in the near future), or (god forbid) swimming in the lava.

They would be very rare and require a lava lake of sufficient size. 

It would be kind of like an end-boss for the nether, very difficult to defeat. Maybe with the new nether update it would drop a bunch of ancient debri blocks. It certainly would fit with the difficulty in obtaining ancient debri.
I kinda had the same idea but mabye adding a lava boat and making out of warped planks AND iron and Maybye it could like run on coal or something.......anyway I hope you like my ideas!

Perhaps not on lava, but instead it can be a giant cave where the serpent moves around, but if it would be on lava, perhaps a enchantment similar to frost walking, but it‚Äôs for lava instead just to make it a bit easier to fight it.
I made a post like this too. I suggested they could bite the player and drag them into the lava and that they could spray lava at you from a short distance.

The Nether is still pretty hard, and interesting. These would be good for a boss, or challenge biome, but are too much for now.

Though,  I would like to see a similar, smaller monster, called the Searing Serpent.

The Searing Serpent could spawn in pcks of 2 to 4, about 1 pack per 900 (30 by 30) block area , and make a loud crackling noise. These guys swim fast in the lava, and set the player on fire with their attack. They attack by jumping up th o 2 blocks high from the lava, and set the player on fire on contact. They do not harm Striders.

The goal of this mob is a terrifying surprise for players who are crossing lava lakes by Strider, or walking around near them.

I think it's a great idea, but the size is to big. I would say make them small and and go on land to fight you but retreat to the lava when it's badly damaged, so you have a chance to get the possible drops
